values: So my mom comes in to work the other day and gives the following report. She was in the living room and noticed that there was a squirrel on the window ledge. then she looked over and saw that there was another one hanging from the screen. The first one suddenly jumped up and started "Humping"(moms own words) the one hanging from the screen. when he was finished he jumped down apparently to have a cigarette. Keep in mind the whole transaction occured while one was clinging o a piece of nylon mesh suspended several feet from the ground and the other was clinging to her. Squirrels just wanna have fu-uunn.
http://droolingfanboy.livejournal.com/16643.html

I had an epiphany on the way home tonight. The Ventures were playing the Hawaii Five-O theme. And it occured to me that CSI miami's David Caruoso is channeling Jack Lord. I never noticed befor but the catch phrases, the overacting that makes even Shatner whince, the hairdo its all there. kinda makes you think doesn't it? (ok well maybe not but its a holiday weekend so I'm cutting way back on thinking.)

He was just a simple man who made people laugh with his peculiar pitching style. He didn't last long in the majors, but he was happy to have made enough to buy his farm. He will be missed here, far away from his home. So long Bird.

In the interest of fairness and equal time I must say Bravo!!! to the Navy for affecting the rescue of that Maersk lines captain from Somali pirates.A long standing tradition of the U.S. navy of kickin' pirate ass is upheld. Dr McNinja would be proud.
http://droolingfanboy.livejournal.com/15954.html

One of the things most folks don't know about me is that i tried real hard in the early 90's to get into the Coast Guard. It was the earliest emergence of that pathological desire to help folks that being a Paramedic ultimately cured forever. In spite of the fact I never got in, the USCG has a special place in my heart. This image reinforces that 
http://www.boatnerd.com/news/newsthumbs/images-09-2/cgredriver.jpg
By way of background this is in Grand Forks N.D.where crews from stations around the Great Lakes region are assisting in the relief effort. 
The coasties don't usually get adequate recognition in the mass media so this is may attempt to rectify that. You don't see the Air Force or the Navy SEALS rescuing little old ladies puppies (or carrying their purses!)not to take anything away from the other services but to me this job is equally relevant.
http://droolingfanboy.livejournal.com/15704.html

Last night's family guy was the funniest i've seen in a very long time. The Meg story was iffy but the Stewie supporting story with the cast of TNG was hilarious. It was worth it just to here Micheal Dorn say "I have to go to the bathroom." Of course the Bar for comedy is set kind of low after watching a marathon 12 heart wrenchingly painful episodes of Battlestar Galactica season 4.0. OMFG are these people ever going to have anything good happen to them? (word on the internet is nope!)I know that the the series is over and I have heard rumours of the outcome but since i have been unable to watch it in absence of cable at my place I will wait for june and netflix to deliver the final blow(take that anyway you choose to)All I can say is that if Ronald D Moore showed up on my door roight now I'd be torn between popping him in the nose and offering him a congratulatory drink. so next week's ofering from Netflix will be Bolt and several episodes of Greg the Bunny.
http://droolingfanboy.livejournal.com/15429.html

I thought when Luna came home that the drama was concluded. When I got home yesterday I found I was wrong. After I retrieved my messages I started for the bedroom I discovered that there was visitor. A calico bullet flew at me from around the corner. The intruder disappeared into the front of the house. 

     I have not seen this new cat since then so I have to conclude that the cat underground railroad is located in one of the front rooms. To that end I have closed off all of the bedrooms and the bathroom in the front of the house. When this cold snap is over I shall search for the cat portal and close it forever. 

     so to sum up i had two cats, then one cat then 
two cats, then three cats and now as of today two.
http://droolingfanboy.livejournal.com/15277.html

So Luna disappeared last friday. she was missing from them until this afternoon. I spotted her in the park and tried to catch her and she ran away. When I got home this afternoon she was sitting on the bed like nothing happened. 

    I have no idea how she got back in. I have no idea how she got out in the first place. I'm glad she's back but i need to find out where the temporal rift is in my house so i can keep her from getting out again. 
    
    On a completely unrelated note, I wonder if they search people before they go into those "American Idol" auditions Because its a wonder no ones ever busted a cap in Simon's pretentious queen ass. I'm just sayin'
http://droolingfanboy.livejournal.com/15027.html

Proust in his first book wrote about, wrote about...
O.K. enough of that. so Christmas happened, it wasn't great but it wasn't horrible either. I got good stuff. new sheets, a new table lamp and an ott lite with a magnifier for painting miniatures and the like. I wish it came with some motivation but alas... 
    The best part of christmas was the fact we didn't have to run willy nilly from one family gathering to the next.Ususally we spend the eve w/ both sides of the family who unfortunately choose to schedule their merry making at the same time.  

    This year since Dad had to work we skipped his side. This no doubt caused some hard feelings but frak them they can take it. We risked life and limb for years getting from one place to the other since invariably ol'mom nature whistles up a blizzard on the evening of the 24th.

    New years was almost non existant. i had invitations to two different friends but chose to stay home and watch the 4 disaster movies i got from netflix instead. My friend Tom came over for a little while and we ate pizza and drank PBR while watching criminal minds. 

   Then I called my friend Kelly, who is technically still married to my friend James even though he left her to go shack up with some girl in Jackson and get her pregnant. That is a whole different story, but suffice it to say she called because he was trying to talk her into getting back together, mainly because girl #2 had just thrown him out, although she did let him back.


   Anyway we talked for a while them emailed for a while and then it was midnight and I watched the sad remains of Dick clark and went to be after consuming a whole bottle of really cheap sparkling wine (andre strawberry fresa, it was dreadful but they had no cold duck which is my traditional poison of choice.)

     On New years day I had dinner at my aunt's house and we watched Michigan state loose and penn state get whomped and i dozed off on her couch and then went home. all in all i would pronounce the holidays satisfactory, Especailly since by burning a few vaction days i have only had to work 5 out of the last 14 days. So, in closing, a belated happy hollidays to all.
http://droolingfanboy.livejournal.com/14605.html

So i was half watching an episode of "Fraiser" and when i looked up his girlfriend had turned into Bob Hoskins. I thought WTF why did fraiser's girlfriend turn into Kruschev?? (for my money His best recent work was in "Enemy at the Gates," a relatively weak movie overall but his portrayal of old "we will bury you was great.)

     Later in the same episode he bathed kelsey while reading poetry, perhaps the real Kruschev did this for Stalin. The moral of this story is,kids if you;re going to watch "Frasier" watch it from the beginning
http://droolingfanboy.livejournal.com/14492.html

So I heard this morning that the International space station and other satellites are in danger from the famous floating tool bag released last week during "Extreme Makeover Space edition"(I can just picture the big reveal "shuttle driver move that shuttle!!") Anyway, there's this $100,000 bag of tools orbiting the earth at 5miles per second that could potentially destroy satellites or damage the ISS before it burns up in the atmosphere. My question is why don't they just zap it with a giant laser? I mean shouldn't the ISS be equipped with a giant laser to defend it from aliens or super villains bent on world domination? Haven't these people seen even one James Bond movie? I'm just saying.
http://droolingfanboy.livejournal.com/14317.html

Come gather 'round people
Wherever you roam
And admit that the waters
Around you have grown
And accept it that soon
You'll be drenched to the bone.
If your time to you
Is worth savin'
Then you better start swimmin'
Or you'll sink like a stone
For the times they are a-changin'.

Come writers and critics
Who prophesize with your pen
And keep your eyes wide
The chance won't come again
And don't speak too soon
For the wheel's still in spin
And there's no tellin' who
That it's namin'.
For the loser now
Will be later to win
For the times they are a-changin'.

Come senators, congressmen
Please heed the call
Don't stand in the doorway
Don't block up the hall
For he that gets hurt
Will be he who has stalled
There's a battle outside
And it is ragin'.
It'll soon shake your windows
And rattle your walls
For the times they are a-changin'.

Come mothers and fathers
Throughout the land
And don't criticize
What you can't understand
Your sons and your daughters
Are beyond your command
Your old road is
Rapidly agin'.
Please get out of the new one
If you can't lend your hand
For the times they are a-changin'.

The line it is drawn
The curse it is cast
The slow one now
Will later be fast
As the present now
Will later be past
The order is
Rapidly fadin'.
And the first one now
Will later be last
For the times they are a-changin'

first let me say I hope Mr zimmerman doesn't sue me for posting that second please forgive my initial lack of enthusiasm for President elect Obama. I am filled with an nearly forgotten sensation. I cant say for sure ut it feels like hope. Confidence that the future doesn't hold more of the same old crap. I tend to be cynical but,.... Whoopeee!!!
The excitement I have seen, on TV, on the net etc makes me think we really could change things and it feels good. P.S. I did vote for Obama, just seemed like the right thing to do, how could I face the polar bears otherwise?
http://droolingfanboy.livejournal.com/13838.html

so i went to my folks house yesterday to clean. i do their housework to pick up a little extra coin. mom got one of those Roomba robot vacuums and it is the coolest thing i have ever seen, well maybe not THE coolest but top ten for sure.

    It has a voice prompt system to tell you when it need assistance, but other than that it just goes on its merry way ricocheting off the furniture and brushing away the surface dirt. Coolest of all when it starts its cycle, backing up from the charging dock it has a little beep beep beep back up alarm like a tiny delivery truck. Too cute.

    Yesterday's cleaning also included a sighting of that most rare of all indoor wildlife, the Spooky. Spooky is one of moms brother and sister cat pairing. both of them are fairly aloof to non residents of the house but spooky is down right anti-social. not a bad cat per se just, well spooky.

    I came upstairs to do the bathroom and he jumped down fron the railing where he had been lounging and regarded me for a moment and then growled at me. I made a few vain attempts at making friends but he really has to be in the mood for it.

     So alas once again we were unsuccessful in our attempts to gain the trust of the wild Spooky. we'll see you next time on mutual of Omaha's wild Kitties.
http://droolingfanboy.livejournal.com/13710.html

So on the front page of the Wall Street Journal today was the headline "McCain wants to stop Rancor." i immediately thought of the scene in Return of the Jedi (being a true geek!) where Luke gets the monster caught under the gate and then Jabba gets pissed and orders them all thrown into the sarlac pit. At this point I would welcome being thrown into said pit as being digested slowly over a thousand years is preferable to another 2 month of campaigning. I honestly don't think i can vote for either of these guys. and its not the lack of experience on Obama's part. I think someone who isn't a Washington insider could be advantageous to us all. My biggest fear is that he will, to quote a west wing episode "drive us to the middle and stay there. That is to say that he will be too afraid of offending anyone to make any real changes. Hillary wouldn't have had that problem. McCain is a republican, that's reason enough for me not to vote for him. One of my friends said something about sarah Palin "sticking to her conservative values" what exactly does that mean? I'm not a liberal by any means but it doesn't seem to me like the conservatives value much of anything other than short term gains for the upper 5% of society. i am sorely tempted to write in mayonnaise for president as my friends at work and I have been discussing. at least it has some value as a condiment. I think the time is right for a palace revolution.
http://droolingfanboy.livejournal.com/13315.html

Last night the cats were fighting. It was quite an elaborate battle royal on the living room floor. As I sometimes do I laughed out loud at their antics. Upon my doing this they ceased their combat and Squeaky, my oldest looked at me with a deep penetrating gaze as if to say"if your gonna laugh at us we'll just quit, we take our work seriously Dad!" then Luna, the younger sister left her spot on the floor and clawed at the carpet, as if to say " that'll teach ya" I looked away for a moment and then saw Luna saunter back over to big sis and slam her shoulder into her. And the fight was on again. I really don't need cable since I have all the sports and drama I need right here.
http://droolingfanboy.livejournal.com/13283.html

On CBS Sunday Morning today Ben Stein did a commentary on the forgotten victims of the mortgage crisis. While dubya and pals are dumping freighter loads of cash on the banks and realtors and such no one is spending a dime extra to take care of the thousands of pets being abandoned by folks fleeing their palaces of pretension that they well knew they couldn't afford. 

    If there was a disaster i would grab my cats and maybe if i had time, pants, and go. I cant conceive of the idea of leaving my girls behind. a pox on all those who would. I know that i am probably preaching to the choir here but I had to mention this. Lets hope that somebody in a position to do something listened when Ben asked for a federal tax credit for those who adopt shelter dogs and cats, money for those shelters and subsidies to save the only real innocent victims of a crisis we could have easily avoided just by being a little less greedy.

I wont dwell on the the subject but I felt i had to say something in the wake of Gary Gygax's death. part of me wants to say its a shame he lived to see what wizards of the pokemon did to his game, but now is not the time. 

Most of the really good times I've had (clothed anyway) involved some variation of D&D so it only seems appropriate to offer a warm thanks to E Gary for all the enjoyment and even the occasional frustration ("damn it how could I possibly roll 10 "1's" in a row") Also condolences to the family for their loss.

so tip your two liter of mt dew and offer up sacrifices of burnt pizza to mark the passing of he who was born king of the geeks.
http://droolingfanboy.livejournal.com/12520.html

I am not sure if this is some bizare sign of success but I have been getting a larger than normal number of E-mail scams lately. 
I don't even have to open them to recognize them. Sometimes though i do, for the comedic value.
     
     Why in the world would anyone in this day and age fall for these things? I am dirt poor and i could certainly use fifty grand from some third world banana republic, but as one of my friends is fond of saying, "I was born at night but it wasn't last night."

     There are unmistakable signs that these things are bs, for example, the director of a major bank would not send business proposals to me on his throwaway yahoo or hot mail account. most banks usually have their own server for that. secondly why of all people in the world did Mr Mobutu pick Me, a nearly middle aged, trailer dwelling food service person to accomplish this task?? I just don't now.
http://droolingfanboy.livejournal.com/12229.html

I am not concerned with the election this year. I don't like anybody who is likely to win their party's nomination, so as I have in the Past I am just going to vote Libertarian. What really bugs me is the TV writers strike. 

    I support them in principle, but the fact is, if I don't get new shows soon i may have to do something drastic, like read a book! (actually I love reading but it relaxes me so well that the only time i usually do it is about half an hour before bed.  

    If the strike continues the networks and major studios are going to use the entertainment equivalent of scabs, reality shows. I am not totally passionate about too many things but by god the onset of so many new reality schlock jobs at once makes my blood boil. 

    My great uncle was in the great 1937 sit down strike in Flint MI. these guys took a great risk to get the right to bargain for a decent wage. The big production companies are screwing the little guys in the writers guild out of a fair share of royalties on DVD sales. Not quite the same but close enough. 

   I say let us all, the viewing public, rise up in support of these poor souls and boycott purchases of dvd's that make the people at the top of the entertainment industry just that much richer. after all these are the same guys that sue people for tens of thousands of dollars just for downloading their crappy music. of course the truth is I can't afford DVDs anyway so, it's easy for me.

To cap it all off I got nicely lit with my friends at home and am anticipating a goo nights sleep

In keeping with the them of my last post these are the top six fictional locations I would like to live in. Again in no particular order

1 Frank Herbert's Dune. Arrakis is harsh and unforgiving but they have way cool weapons and the chicks are tough.

2 The Star Wars universe. episodes 4-6 only please, the old republic was so wimpy it deserved to fall. (one exception to this, if you count the clone wars cartoon, that would be cool.)

3 the Star Trek universe. original series to next gen and spin-offs inclusive. Dude, green Orion slave girls!!!

4 Futurama's New New York. sleazy robots, hot one eyed alien chicks and talking lobsters.

5 The Tenth kingdom. I have only recently discovered this vastly underrated miniseries. I am not huge into fantasy, but this is one fairy tale i could handle

6 Firefly/Serenity. I have a tendency to support lost causes

I will note for the record that I considered but rejected Middle Earth, mainly because it seemed like the sort of thing every body else would say.
http://droolingfanboy.livejournal.com/11182.html

In no particular order these are six ( I tried to narrow it to 5 but no dice)fictional personae I would enjoy meeting and the reasons why.

Hannibal Lector Okay, I know creepy one to lead off the list but I am just fascinated by the super intelligent serial killer type. perhaps we could have a nice dinner with fava beans and chianti

Martin Cruz Smith's Arkady Renko. Star of Gorky Park and several other offbeat police thrillers this russian Anti hero is a compelling character in spite of the fact that he is terribly ordinary.

Clive Cussler's Dirk Pitt. A fascinating well rounded rennaissance man. Pus he has tons of cool cars.

Indiana Jones. Oh the stories he could tell.

Rick Blaine of "Casablanca" We could sit up all night smoking unfiltered cigarettes drinking scotch and bitching about our exes.

Ursula Vernon's Digger. An up right walking talking wombat, in a stylish vest? c'mon who wouldn't want to meet her?

I the cubs win the pennant I am going to dig a big hole in the back yard and fill it with lawyers guns and money because the S#$t is going to hit the fan. my friend Jeff died the 21st of last month after a short illness. he was 36 years old. he and I worked together at Mobile medical response for almost there years before he and his family moved to Arizona. I now live in their old mobile home. Jeff was a great guy and it really sucks that he died so young. The township fire department is going to hold a memorial service for him next month and dedicate one of their rigs to him. He will be sorely missed by all those who knew him.
http://droolingfanboy.livejournal.com/10344.html

I am at a crossroads in my life. My choices are relativelvely simple. Stay here and rot in the worst economy in the country or take a chance on moving out west where I only know two people and will be thousands of miles away from family if there is a problem. If I move I am pretty sure I can get a good job. The Park County hospital in Cody WY is looking for a Medic supervisor or i can be a line cook for 9-10 bucks an hour. There is no state income tax, the sales tax is only 4% and gas is way cheaper. On the other hand it will cost a butt load of money to move and I have this trailer to get rid of. I expect to take a bath on it if I do sell, but i would like to at least make enough to pay what i still owe. I just feel like I have gone as far as I can go here. Leaving would suck for a lot of reasons though. My mom is starting a business that I am part of, most of my friends and family are here, I don't totally hate my job and there are benefits involved. I have been wrestling with this for a while and I just thought i would throw it out there for anyone else to comment on what they recommend.
http://droolingfanboy.livejournal.com/10103.html

I have come to the conclusion that if T.V. was nothing but crime dramas i would stay home and watch all the time. i cant seem to get enough of the genre. The various permutations of CSI are the best, although i don't much care for the David Carouso Show. I'm sure he probably doesn't give a rat's ass about me either, but i still watch occasionally just to see Emily Proctor. (sigh) I have also enjoyed the Law and Order triplets for a number of years although now I mainly watch SVU because of the too frequent partner changes on regular L&O. NCIS is cool, I thought i wouldn't like it but apparently i was wrong. THe new Jeff Goldbloom show where he hallucinates about the dead people is pretty cool but I am afraid they will have a hard time keeping up the premise for too long. fortunately the crime drama tends to be more durable than the sitcom which the networks seem to change out once a week. Apart from that about the only new first run show i enjoy any more is Battlestar Galactica. The Office is cool but I almost never get to watch it because I have to work thursday nights virtually without exception, this also leaves me out of Scrubs but I can watch the re runs on comedy central.  I guess the point, if there is one is that the networks should make more procedural crime dramas, hopefully they will squeeze out the vile disgusting reality crap and make T.V safe for people of nominal I.Q.s again

So I was driving home the other day with my fish dinner from LJS when I spotted an interesting license plate number. A little background, i take inordinate pleasure in spotting plate number/letter combo's that have dirty implications. Even ones that suggest the possibility that another plate later in the series might be naughty. For example a plate with the letters BEG and numbers 462 offers the possibility that somewhere in the great state of michigan there is a person driving around with the plate BEG 469.(Oh yes, PLEASE!!! really not going to get taken up now!)So the other night I saw a plate which bore the numbers 7ftK00. On michigan plates the zero looks the same as the letter "O" so theoretically there is a plate out there the proudly proclaims 7ft POO, actually there could be a series of 1ft to 9ft out there. This makes me happy to a degree which is worrisome.
http://droolingfanboy.livejournal.com/9206.html

So I spent the weekend with my friends Kellie and James being Best man at their wedding. Simultaneously my friend Amanda got married(justice of the peace w/ no reception)Sadly due to bad timing I couldnt attend both ceremonies. Originally Amanda and Tom were planning to get hitched on thursday, but because of the holiday they had to wait until friday, at which time I was racing around the back country of Gratiot county getting tuxedos, helping get the hall ready and rehearsing the ceremony in hopes of staving off a major nuptial faux pas. The wedding went off without a hitch everything was beautiful and I managed not to cry too much.( I am such a girl when it comes to these kinds of things. There was no alcohol at the reception and yet we all stilkl had a good time. For reasons I still can't full explain I carried James' sister Lisa,the Maid of Honor, into the hall in my arms. (Kellie's brother Chris carried his girlfriend over his shoulder like a firefighter so I guess it was peer pressure.)Lisa is a petite girl and is smokin' hot but she's engaged to a guy she's never met in person before who is currently stationed in Alaska. Anyway the whole experience was great, except for the fact that now that they are wed James and Kellie are moving to Wyoming. They say that they're coming back, in fact they promised me they would but I have serious abandonment issues so I'm having a hard time with that.I got them a phone for their wedding gift so I think they will get the hint that I want them to stay in touch. Oh and by the way even though the reception was dry we still managed to get a little tipsy. once the party broke up at the hall we went to a little redneck bar and got hammered and sang Karaoke. A fitting end to the day.

so today's paper had an article that said that Christmas, etc has always been a miserable cavlacade of greed and avarice. it noted, among other tings that it coincides with the roman festival of Saturnalia, which was mostly about drinking gambling and sex.(woo hoo!) It also notes that in the middle ages young men who had little work to do, the harvest being in by now went from door to door singing threatening songs to coerce friends and neighbors into giving them food and drink. this is the beginning of the tradition known as "wassailing".
So I don't feel quite as bad about current crass commercailism because at least it doesn't include extortion. Anyway before I go to my friends houses and threaten to kick their asses if they don't help me get my snack on a merry christmas chappy Chanukah Cool yule and all the other assorted winter solstice related holiday greetings to all and to all a good night

So Black Friday has come and gone without significant damage to my soul or self respect. I really don't look forward to the day after thanksgiving since I work in retail. I don't think anybody really does look forward to it. I sincerely hope they regard it as a necessity to gotten over with. On CNN or msnbc or one of the other money worshiping networks the other day I saw a reporter saying that people see christmas gift purchases as neccessary ratther than optional. I feel that way too, I am ashamed to admit due largely to the guilt I know I'll have if I don't produce copious gifts on Dec. 25 to celebrate how jesus came to save Wall-mart. 
    the retailer I work for (I wont mention the name but it rhymes with "Gears") likes to use the word mandatory in conjunction with a lot of the unreasonable expectations they place on us at this time of year. I work on a commission basis, if you don't sell you don't eat. The store mangement has been pulling a lot of, You have to do this extra task, crap lately and using the "M" word in association with it. Now, correct me if I'm wrong but isn't compelling someone to do something essentially without pay against the law? My great great great grandfather fought in a war about that particular isssue. anyway if you haven't guessed I'm ticked about that. 
    It probably doesnt help that I am missing my friend Amanda who ran away to Holland to get knocked up by a guy who, under other circumstances I would probably be friends with.Or that my friend James announced he was moving to Wyoming, apparently to be a cowboy. But the real center of all this is that , no matter how I try I can't reproduce the feeling I got at this time of year when I was younger. I know we idealize the past but it just seems that life at this time of year didn't seem to SUCK so bad when I was less than say thirteen. 
 anyway, I was thinking of sleeping through the rest of the holidays but people talked me out of it. Woe unto them if this year sucks just as much as previously.
http://droolingfanboy.livejournal.com/7335.html

I am a terrible, terrible person. I have a finite amount of time in any given day to do everything i have to do. Work and sleep take up nearly all of most days. So consequently i have to ration the amount of time I spend with friends. The criteria upon which this is based is entirely self serving. The number one contender for my time are people who may give me something such as money, food, candy, beer or sexual favors (sadly far too little of the last one in recent times.)
Next are the ones who are doing something I want to do. for example my gaming friends. After that are people who are doing things I don't want to do but I feel obligated to so I participate to asuage guilt. Last, but also least are friends who move to the Netherlands to marry a man they met in a chat room. Thre is only one of these and she knows who she is. I'm pretty sure she doesn't read my posts but, this will tell for certain. Anyway ex girlfriend issues aside this whol diatribe is a form of confession for me. It also is sort of a quest for validation. If there is anyone out there reading this who does the same thing please let me know so I can feel like less of a bastard.

So heres a load of stuff that's been on my mind
A.weird dreams. I have been taking naps in between job A ath the loacal cider mill/bakery and job B at Sears. The quality of dreams is quite bizzare when they happen at all. I dreamed a rather complex plot to a Star Trek DS 9 episode involving quark wanting to get a printing press to print money. Then I dreamed my grandmother, who has been gone for over a decade now had taken in one of my co workers at Sears as a border.
B. Video game tournaments signal the end of society. Look in revalations, its there I tells Ya. Actually, its not, but when people can win 50 grand for playing age of empires can the end be far from nigh? I Have never made 50 grand doing any of the things that I vhave done. Not in a year's time anyway. Yeah sure I'm jealous but it doesn't make it right. 
C.Grandpa-isms. My maternal grandfather had a rather colorful mode of speach. He was an intelligent, litterate man and was knowledgeable in a number of areas. He, however had quite a short temper and tended to voice his opinion in rather picturesque ways. My favorite phrases of his were as follows (as regards something dropped on the floor "it O.K. don't pick it up i'll just find it later with my bare feet." (when something he didn't want to watch was announced as "coming up next")"Not on My T.V." When he thought something was useless he would say it was"not worth the powder it would take to blow it to hell"
He reffered to the Beatles as whamity bang music and he would often say he couldn't set something down becase every flat surface in the place was covered.

So lately I have spent a lot of time on the phone talking to those recorded press one for this press two for that systems. I can usually navigate the menus pretty well but when it comes time to talk to a person... get out the books and other reading material pack a lunch and prepare to stay for the day. Th thing that gets me is that they play music but interrupt it every ten to fifteen seconds with messages basically telling you you're still on hold.nobody believes that their call is important to these mythical recorded phone message gods, if it was someone would have answered by now. so i have to stand around at work feeling and no doubt looking like an idiot telling a real live customer that we have to wait while a fake recorded voice tells me how valuable my time is. Progress my butt!!

so i have been working on my parent's yard, raking leaves and such, in accordance with the rules of the universe which suggest that when it is spring we must clean. I worked on the the back yard today. I cleared out the leaves which collected in the window wells and around the screened in porch. The work revealed many surprises. A race of hydrostone turtles once thought to be extinct, the elaborate system of wiring left by a previous civilization to power small garden lights and most significantly the tender shoots of the violets which will soon spead a thick green robe over the ground surrounding the back porch. It was somewhat like archeology. The plan for the near future is to dig out, then grade and level the area next to the porch and place conctete pavers to make a patio. then i think Mom may finally give in to the pressure i have been exerting to build a water feature in the front yard. I must get out the tapes of Ground Force and review them.

There has been much discussion of late about the presence of a (1) Wolverine in Michigan's thumb. (my state is the only one in the union that you can show where you come from just by holding up your hand and pointing I grew up in a town that was near the webbing in between the thumb and forefinger.) Anyway some hunters spotted this critter about a year ago. since hunters in michigan drink a lot there was scepticism at first but they produced a significant quantity of video some of it very close up. i assume they used a hidden camera or a godly zoom lens because you just don't get that close to a wolverine. They are not cuddly!! take my word on this. gulo gulo would just as soon rip your eyes out as look at ya. However the uproar that this ONE wolverine has caused is fairly amusing. Yeah they are fierce and ill tempered and they can threaten poultry and livestock but this is one animal. There was a special report on one of the local news programs that purported to speculate about whether or not to kill the thing! Its one bloody wolverine guys,slow news day?? Now I could see if it was some sort of wolverine terrorist cell with tiny weapons of mass distruction, but the evidence presented so far suggests only one animal. coyotes walk the streets in most residential neighborhoods in michigan after dark but the White House hasn't placed them in an axis of evil with bears and stoats. Any way the point of this is that we should embrace this creature (not litteraly) since it is the return of a species long thought to be vanished from the area and not try to ethnically cleanse it.
